content: ever after blanket by maree buscke this is a great pattern because its quick to knit up makes a great gift and can be customised across all yarn weights a perfect project for beginners i have chosen a very simple lace pattern that gives you that looks much harder than it actually is effect abbreviations k1 = knit one stitch k2tog = knit 2 stitches together yo = yarn over take the yarn from the back of your work through to the front & over the needle to knit to complete a blanket measuring approx 120cm wide to add width increase the pattern by a multiple of 12 stitches to maintain pattern the gauge is a guide for how many stitches per 10cm yarn is approximate estimate to allow you to customise as desired yarn qty balls gauge sts = 10cm needle - 80cm or larger stitches cast on circular 4ply/sport 7 10 x 50gm 24sts 3 75mm 288 8ply/dk 8 12 x 50gm 20 sts 4 5mm 240 10ply/aran 10 14 x 50gm 16 sts 5mm 192 12ply/bulky 12 16 x 50gm 14 sts 6mm 168 14ply/chunky 14 20 x 50gm 12 sts 7mm 144 ever after blanket cast on stitches using table above for needle size and stitch count work 12 row garter stitch row 1 of pattern k6 k2tog twice yo k1 4 times k2tog 4 times repeat until last 8 sts yo k1 4 times k2tog twice k6 row 2 k6 purl to last 6 stst k6 row 3 knit row 4 k6 purl to last 6 stst k6 repeat the pattern until length desired ending with row 4 of pattern less the width of 12 row of garter stitch work row 1 of the pattern work 12 row garter stitch cast off make up weave in ends & lightly steam block if desired
